    • adjustCv

      private static double adjustCv(double Cv, double percentValveOpening)
      Adjusts the flow coefficient (Cv) based on the percentage valve opening.
      Parameters:
      Cv - Flow coefficient in US gallons per minute (USG/min).
      percentValveOpening - Percentage valve opening (0 to 100).
      Returns:
      Adjusted flow coefficient (Cv) in US gallons per minute (USG/min).

    • liquidValveMassFlow

      public static double liquidValveMassFlow(double P1, double P2, double rho, double Cv, double Fp, double percentValveOpening)
      Calculates the mass flow rate through a control valve for a liquid based on the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      P1 - Upstream pressure in bar.
      P2 - Downstream pressure in bar.
      rho - Density of the fluid in kilograms per cubic meter (kg/m³).
      Cv - Flow coefficient in US gallons per minute (USG/min).
      Fp - Piping geometry factor (dimensionless).
      percentValveOpening - Percentage valve opening (0 to 100).
      Returns:
      Mass flow rate in kilograms per hour (kg/h).

    • calcPercentValveOpeningLiquid

      public static double calcPercentValveOpeningLiquid(double massFlowRate, double P1, double P2, double rho, double Cv, double Fp)
      Calculates the percent valve opening given the mass flow rate through a valve, upstream pressure (P1), downstream pressure (P2), fluid density (rho), flow coefficient (Cv), and piping geometry factor (Fp).
      Parameters:
      massFlowRate - The mass flow rate through the valve in kg/hr.
      P1 - The upstream pressure in bar.
      P2 - The downstream pressure in bar.
      rho - The density of the fluid in kilograms per cubic meter (kg/m³).
      Cv - The flow coefficient of the valve in US gallons per minute (USG/min).
      Fp - The piping geometry factor (dimensionless).
      Returns:
      The percent valve opening.

    • liquidValvePout

      public static double liquidValvePout(double P1, double m, double rho, double Cv, double Fp, double percentValveOpening)
      Calculates the downstream pressure (P2) through a control valve for a liquid based on the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      P1 - Upstream pressure in bar.
      m - Mass flow rate in kilograms per hour (kg/h).
      rho - Density of the fluid in kilograms per cubic meter (kg/m³).
      Cv - Flow coefficient in US gallons per minute (USG/min).
      Fp - Piping geometry factor (dimensionless).
      percentValveOpening - Percentage valve opening (0 to 100).
      Returns:
      Downstream pressure in bar.

    • liquidValveCv

      public static double liquidValveCv(double P1, double P2, double rho, double m, double Fp, double percentValveOpening)
      Calculates the flow coefficient (Cv) of a control valve for a liquid based on the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      P1 - Upstream pressure in bar.
      P2 - Downstream pressure in bar.
      rho - Density of the fluid in kilograms per cubic meter (kg/m³).
      m - Mass flow rate in kilograms per hour (kg/h).
      Fp - Piping geometry factor (dimensionless).
      percentValveOpening - Percentage valve opening (0 to 100).
      Returns:
      Flow coefficient (Cv) in US gallons per minute (USG/min).

    • calcmassflow

      public double calcmassflow(double Pus, double Pds, double rhous, double Cv, double percentValveOpening)
      Calculates the mass flow rate through a valve given the upstream pressure (Pus), downstream pressure (Pds), fluid density (rhous), and flow coefficient (Cv).

      The calculation is based on the formula for mass flow through a valve.

      Parameters:
      Pus - The upstream pressure (Pus) in bara.
      Pds - The downstream pressure (Pds) in bara.
      rhous - The density of the fluid upstream of the valve in kg/m^3.
      Cv - The flow coefficient of the valve.
      percentValveOpening - Opening of valve in %
      Returns:
      The mass flow rate through the valve in kg/hr.

    • calcValvePout

      public double calcValvePout(double Pus, double rhous, double Cv, double massFlowRate, double percentValveOpening)
      Calculates the downstream pressure (Pds) of a valve given the upstream pressure (Pus), fluid density (rhous), flow coefficient (Cv), mass flow rate, and the percent valve opening. The calculation is based on the formula for mass flow through a valve, rearranged to solve for Pds.
      Parameters:
      Pus - The upstream pressure (Pus) in bara.
      rhous - The density of the fluid upstream of the valve in kg/m^3.
      Cv - The flow coefficient of the valve.
      massFlowRate - The mass flow rate through the valve in kg/hr.
      percentValveOpening - Opening of valve in %
      Returns:
      The downstream pressure (Pds) in bara.

    • calcCv

      public double calcCv(double Pus, double Pds, double rhous, double massFlowRate, double percentValveOpening)
      Calculates the flow coefficient (Cv) of a valve given the upstream pressure (Pus), downstream pressure (Pds), fluid density (rhous), mass flow rate, and the percent valve opening. The calculation is based on the formula for mass flow through a valve, rearranged to solve for Cv.
      Parameters:
      Pus - The upstream pressure (Pus) in bara.
      Pds - The downstream pressure (Pds) in bara.
      rhous - The density of the fluid upstream of the valve in kg/m^3.
      massFlowRate - The mass flow rate through the valve in kg/hr.
      percentValveOpening - Opening of valve in %
      Returns:
      The flow coefficient (Cv) of the valve.

    • calcPercentValveOpening

      public double calcPercentValveOpening(double Pus, double Pds, double rhous, double Cv, double massFlowRate)
      Calculates the percent valve opening given the upstream pressure (Pus), downstream pressure (Pds), fluid density (rhous), flow coefficient (Cv), and mass flow rate. The calculation is based on the formula for mass flow through a valve, rearranged to solve for percent valve opening.
      Parameters:
      Pus - The upstream pressure (Pus) in bara.
      Pds - The downstream pressure (Pds) in bara.
      rhous - The density of the fluid upstream of the valve in kg/m^3.
      Cv - The flow coefficient of the valve.
      massFlowRate - The mass flow rate through the valve in kg/hr.
      Returns:
      The percent valve opening.

    • runTransient

      public void runTransient(double dt, UUID id)

      runTransient

      This method calculates thermodynamic and unit operations using difference equations if available and calculateSteadyState is true. Use setCalculateSteadyState to set the parameter. Sets calc identifier UUID.
      Specified by:
      runTransient in interface SimulationInterface
      Parameters:
      dt - Delta time [s]
      id - Calculation identifier
